TextView.android:text: Assistance to Children in Need of Special Protection (CNSP)

Assistance/services provided to children with special needs to immediately respond on cases of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation; children in conflict with the law; ensures immediate access to appropriate services and provides solutions in the child’s best interest

Rape victims, victims of child trafficking, physically abused/maltreated children, children who committed offense (ages below 15 years old, children who committed offense with imposable penalty of not more than 6 years imprisonment for ages above 15 but below 18 years old; below 15 years old who committed offense with imposable penalty of less than 6 years imprisonment (for victimless crime)
Rural Health Unit of the area or any nearest government hospital
Subscribed by Municipal Mayor or Prosecutor’s Office, Malaybalay City
4. Social Case Study Report (1 set original copy)
A. ASSISTANCE TO CHILDREN ABUSED VICTIM - SURVIVOR
1.1. Secure victim’s safety by temporary safekeeping and protection at Kitaotao Children and Women Center
2.1. Conducts interview and assessment of needs with Multi-Disciplinary Team (MDT)
4.1. Facilitates temporary safekeeping and protection of victim - survivor at KCWC or government institution
B. ASSISTANCE TO VICTIM OF CHILD TRAFFICKING
1. Refers to DSWD-Home for Girls or any institution for safety
1.1. Receives notice from institution regarding the victim
2.1. Inform biological parents/guardian of victim’s present situation
C. ASSISTANCE TO CHILDREN IN CONFLICT WITH THE LAW (CICL) (below 15 years old) with or without discernment for offense committed with imposable penalty of not more than 6 years imprisonment
1.1. Conducts interview/data gathering together with the Multi-Disciplinary Team
2. Stays temporarily at Kitaotao Children and Women Center in the locality if found abandoned or neglected
2.1. Determines if child is abandoned or neglected. If so, facilitates admission at center
3. If with parents, present Birth Certificate and returns to parents/guardian
3.1. Ask copy of Birth Certificate from parents/guardian & turn over minor to them
D. ASSISTANCE TO CHILDREN IN CONFLICT WITH THE LAW (CICL) above 15 years old but below 18 years old with discernment (for imposable penalty of more than 6 years imprisonment)
1. Refers to social worker of KCWC-MSWDO
1.1. Conducts interview and data gathering together with Multi-Disciplinary Team (MSWDO, PNP-WCPD & MHO)
3.1. Guides minor in answering DAT to determine if offense committed is with discernment or not
E. ASSISTANCE TO CHILDREN IN CONFLICT WITH THE LAW (CICL) BELOW 15 YEARS OLD (FOR VICTIM - LESS CRIME)
1. CICL commits offense apprehended by Law enforcement officer referred to MSWDO social worker
3. Stay at Kitaotao Children Center if child is found abandoned or neglected
3.1. Determine if child is abandoned or Neglected
3.2. File Involuntary Commitment in court if found abandoned or neglected
